name: Computer Algebra System
description: Performs symbolic mathematical computations including algebraic manipulation, calculus, and equation solving
when_to_use: Matrix operations and linear algebra symbolically
when_not_to_use: Numerical approximations for efficiency (use numeric libraries)
Real-time computations with tight performance constraints
Problems requiring only numerical answers at specific points
Very large symbolic expressions causing memory issues

complexity.time: Highly variable; symbolic operations can be exponential in expression size
complexity.space: O(expression_size) for expression trees and simplification caches

parameters.name: symbols
parameters.description: Symbolic variables to use (x, y, z, etc)

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: differentiate, integrate, simplify, factor, solve, etc

embedding_text: Computer Algebra System (CAS) handles symbolic mathematical computation. Systems like SymPy provide symbolic differentiation (derivative), integration (integrate), equation solving (solve), and expression simplification. Operates on symbolic expressions preserving mathematical relationships. Useful for exact answers and mathematical proofs rather than numerical approximation.
